description: From Latin benefactus (“benefited”) plus -ive. Attested since the twentieth century.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Of or pertaining to the linguistic form or case or the semantic role of the beneficiary of an action. Expressed in English as "on behalf of" or "on one's behalf."
A term or sentence element that serves a benefactive role or that is inflected for the benefactive case or a similar case (such as the dative case).
